ORDRE DU JOUR : ; 1. —Rapport da Conseil d’Administration sur.'la situation des affaires de la Socidtd. 2. —Rapport de Messieurs les Censeurs. 3. —Approbation des oomptes et fixation da dividende. 4. —Nomination de deux Censeurs poor l'exeroioe 1905-1906 et fixation de lenr indemnitd annnelle. 5. —Renonvellement par tiers du Conseil d'Administration. NOTICE. The large warehouse belonging to the Govt, known as the “Red B tracks’’ situated at Minet el Bassal near the Gabbiri Gdb.ls Station and on the Bank of the Mahmohdieh Canal will be offered for sale by pnblio auction at the Govemorate of Alexandria on May 25th 1905 between the hours of 9 am. and noon. The building oocupies an area of over 18,000 sq. metres. The upset price for the land and buildings is £25,000. The building is open to inspection by tho Publio every day from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Plans and specifications may be seen at tho Ministry of Finance, Government Linds Office, or at the Governorate of Alexandria. For farther information apply to H.E. the Governor of Alexandria. 25950-6-5 Tlos. Cook & Son (Egypt), Ltd.

AVIS La Municipality met en adjudication les travaux de macadamisage de la rente d’Abonkir du Bazar de Bmxh k la Station Gabrial. Le cautionnement est fix6 k L.E. 100 (oent). Le cahier des charges est ddposd au bureau dela Voirie oh il peut fitre cousultd par les intéressais tons les jours de 9 Lk midi,les jours fdrida exceptds.

Les offres devront fitre ad resales sous pli ca- chets k Monsieur rAdministrateur de la Muni- cipality avant le 30 Mai 1905. EUes ponrront ygalement fitre dyposyes en syanoe de la Ddldgation le mftme jour k 5b.p,m. L’enveloppe devra porter en outre la men- tion : " Soumission pour macadamisage route d’Aboukir.

Le cautionnement ou le re^u d'une Banque, d'aprks les conditkma do cahier des charges, devra etre remis sdpardmont Au Service de la Comptabilité GlShdrale avant l’ouverture des offres et an plus tard le 30 Mai k midi. Tonte offre qui ne remplit pas les conditions ci-deasus sera dcartde. L’Administrateur, (Signd) W. P. Chataway Alexandrie, le 16 Mai 1905. 25978-8-3 G. Hewat & Co., 2 packages effects Various, 1 package sundries British Chamber of Commebck.—We would call the attention of persons interested in Egyptian trade to the work of the British Chamber of Commerce of Egypt, whose office in Alexandriagiverinformation asto standings trade, &o., to its members, and whose monthly publication reviews onr commerce. The anuu. 1 subscription is £1 and all British traders should beoome members. Onr London office, 36, New Broad- street B.C., acts as London agency t» the Chao bar.

ENGRAIS NATURALS GOMPLETS PouUrmttam, EmgPalB OMmlqu9B Orgamliw*. The issue is being made simultaneously in England and in Egypt. The subscription lists will open on Thursday, the 18th of May, and close on or before Friday, the 19th of May, 1905. ' A Prospectus has been Filed with the Registrar of Joint Stock Companies which among other things says North Egypt Larjd Coy. LIMITED. (Incorporated under the Companies Acts, 1862 to 1900). CAPITAL . . . £230,000, Divided into 230,000 Shares of £f each. Present Issue ......................... The Vendor stipulates fir the allot- ment to himself of 30,000 Shares in part payment of the purchase consi* deration ........................... Held in reserve ... ................... ... 100,000 Shares 30.000 100.000 230,000 The proceeds of 30,000 Shares of tide issue will be set apart' for Worth* Capital (subject to payment of the preliminary expenses estimated at £2,000). Subscriptions are now invited for 100,000 Shares at par, payable 5/- on Application, 6/- on Allotment
The balance of 10/- one month after Allotment. The subscription upon which the Directors will allot- being 100,000 Shares, and the Subscription of these 100,000 Shares having been gua- ranteed, the Board will proceed to allotment on the closing of the Lists. Subscribers may, on payment in full of the Shares allotted to them, receive Share Warrants to Bearer in respect of such allotments if desired. The Right Hon. the EARL OF GALLOWAY, 74 Eccleeton Square, London, 8.W. (Chairman). Sir BRADFORD LESLIE, K.C.I.E., M.Inat. C.B., 8, Sussex Place, London, N.W. (Chairman, Southern Punjab Railway Company, and Director, British Central Africa Co.) AUGUSTUS DURANT, Esq., 32, Gresham Street, London E.U, Merchant, (Chairman, E. W. Tarry 4 Co., Limited). PROSPECTUS. THIS Company has been formed for the purposes set out in its Memorandum of Association, and in particular to acquire, under the contract referred to, and to oultmte and deal with the Freehold Bitate, about 14,500 feddans (about 15,000 acres, equal to1 6,092 hectares or 215 sq uafe miles) situate at Hammam, in the district of Mariont, in Bgyyt, being a portion of the estate of H.H. the Khedive of Egypt. The property has been reported upon by Messrs. Sir Doaglaa Fox and Partners, Consulting Engineers of the Company and the conclusion of their Report to the Di- rectors, dated 26th January, 1905, is as follows:— Taking a broad view of the whole matter, we feel that we can recommend the property, and that-with' a canal constructed and given sufficient water, your Compauy formed to acquire and work the Batata, should prove a success. Aooompanying the Report from which the above extracts are made are. okloula- tions m&de'ftW Messrs; Sir Douglas Fox and Partners by Mr. Alohevsky, Ingenior Agronome, as to the quantity of water required to irrigate the Brtate and the various crops per feddan which should be produoed therefrom, and the conclusion of these estimates is that when the whole of the area is under cultivation the orops will pro- duce, as a minimum estimate, a net profit of £72,000 per annum. Early application will be made to the Egyptian Government, as reoommended by Sir Douglas Fox 4 Partners in their report, for the extension of the Nnbarieh Oanal to irrigate the Company’s lands with Nile water. The Company has a reserve of 100,000 Shares to provide farther working capital, in order to seiner to this Company the full benefit of such extension as soon as granted, and in tho meantime the land will oontinue to be cultivated with the water of toe existing wells- and natural rainfall, supplemented by auoh further wells as the Company’s Engineers recommend.
Applications for official quotations for the Company’s Shares will be made to the London Stock Exchange, and the Bones of Alexandria and Cairo. Copies of the Contracts and of tho Report of Sir Douglas Fox and Partners and the Memorandum and Articles of Association of the Company can be soon at the Offices of the Company in Alexandria and at the Offices of Maitre Carton de Wiart, Cairo, until the closing of the lists, daring business hours.
Applications for shares to be made on the forms accompanying the Prospectus and for- warded with the amount payable on application to the Company's Bankers in Alexandria or Cairo.
Failure to pay installments when due will render payments already made liable to forfeiture. ^n^Pr^turee with forms of application can be obtained from the Compass Subscriptions for shares will only be received on the application forms accompanying toe complete prospectus, copies of which may be had’ on application to any of the Officiy
